Rally Held in S. Korea to Declare 2005 as Year of U.S. Troop Pullout
articles.content:
Rally Held in S. Korea to Declare 2005 as Year of U.S. Troop Pullout 
    Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- A rally declaring 2005 as the year of the U.S. troops' pullout was reportedly held in front of the U.S. embassy in Seoul on January 8 under the sponsorship of the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration.
 A resolution read out at the rally said that the division can be terminated, the threat of war removed and the independent reunification of the Korean Peninsula achieved only when the south and the north form a south-north joint measure committee for the withdrawal of the U.S. troops and the 70 million fellow countrymen struggle in unity.    
 A rally of the Seoul District Federation of University Student Councils was held on the same day in front of the U.S. embassy to vow to wage an all-out struggle against the U.S. and war.

Gifts to Kim Jong Il from U.S. Congress Delegation
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Il from U.S. Congress Delegation
    Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the U.S. Congress delegation on a visit to the DPRK.
 Curt Weldon, vice-chairman of the Armed Services Committee of the U.S. House of Representatives who is leading the delegation, Thursday handed the gift over to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.    
 Also a gift to Kim Jong Il from the head of the delegation was conveyed to him.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets U.S. Congress Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets U.S. Congress Delegation
    Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met with the U.S. Congress delegation headed by Curt Weldon, vice-chairman of the Armed Services Committee of its House of Representatives, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
 At the meeting there was a conversation on pending issues between both sides.    
 On hand were Kim Kye Gwan, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.

articles.title: U.S. Congressmen Tour Various Parts of Pyongyang
articles.content:
U.S. Congressmen Tour Various Parts of Pyongyang
    Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- The U.S. delegation of Congressmen led by Curt Weldon, vice-chairman of the Armed Services Committee of the House of Representatives, has toured various parts of Pyongyang since its arrival in the city on Jan. 11.
 The delegation visited the Tower of the Juche Idea, Kim Il Sung University and the Pyongyang Metro Thursday in the wake of its sightseeing tour Wednesday.
